cell.color:
A geyser is a form of natural hot spring that sometimes spurts steam and water into the air. Geysers can occur in locations where spring water seeps down through the rock and comes into contact with hot molten magma. The heated water turns into steam and then rises back to the surface, sometimes erupting violently.
The geyser is a tour object. If a guest sees a tour object while on a tour, it increases the guest's tour rating and tour donation.

The bat cave is home to hundreds of small bats. Contrary to their frightening reputation, most bats are quite harmless. Having bats nearby can actually be a benefit, since bats eat annoying insects such as the mosquito.
The bat cave is a tour object. If a guest sees a tour object while on a tour, it increases the guest's tour rating and tour donation.

The rock pool is a beautiful addition to your zoo. Water-loving big cats, such as tigers, also love to play in the rock pool's cool waters.
The rock pool is a tour object. If a guest sees a tour object while on a tour, it increases the guest's tour rating and tour donation.

A volcano is a fissure in the earth where hot molten magma erupts to the surface, sometimes violently. Fortunately, this volcano is (usually) dormant!
The volcano is a tour object. If a guest sees a tour object while on a tour, it increases the guest's tour rating and tour donation.

The sequoia tunnel allows Jeep® vehicles to drive through a naturally-occurring fissure in a living giant sequoia tree. The sequoia tunnel can only be placed on a road.
The sequoia tunnel is a tour object. If a guest sees a tour object while on a tour, it increases the guest's tour rating and tour donation.

The snow machine generates a frosty snowstorm that will delight your guests. It's perfect for your tundra exhibits.
The snow machine is a tour object. If a guest sees a tour object while on a tour, it increases the guest's tour rating and tour donation.

This large geological formation will fascinate your guests. It looks especially striking in desert and scrub exhibits.
The mineral deposit is a tour object. If a guest sees a tour object while on a tour, it increases the guest's tour rating and tour donation.

The fog machine generates a thick fog that adds atmosphere to your wetlands exhibits.
The fog machine is a tour object. If a guest sees a tour object while on a tour, it increases the guest's tour rating and tour donation.
Whenever an endangered or critically endangered animal in your zoo has a baby, you receive a balloon bouquet as a colorful souvenir! Guests enjoy seeing balloon bouquets while on a tour.

Guests love traveling through the sparkling, shimmering interior of the crystal tunnel.
The crystal tunnel is a tour object. If a guest sees a tour object while on a tour, it increases the guest's tour rating and tour donation.

Guests enjoy seeing statues around your zoo, especially while they're on a tour.
To make the Zoo Attendance Statue available in your game, 20,000 guests must visit your zoo.

Guests enjoy seeing statues around your zoo, especially while they're on a tour.
To make the Animal Babies Statue available in your game, win the Endangered Babies award.
